cd:Record.name: Level_1B_Processing_Parameters_04_11
cd:Record.cd:Description: Level 1B Processing Parameters GADS DSR
List of Data Set Records
Data Set Record
Fields responsible for populating the Fixed Header

cd:Integer.cd:Description: 4 digits used to distinguish between versions of a file having the same validity period

cd:Record.cd:Description: Values responsible for populating the main product header

cd:Text.cd:Description: Software version number of processing software. Format: name of processor (up to 10 char) version number (4 char)

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Wind Velocity Measurement

cd:Text.cd:Description: String indicating source of AISP data product. If set to 'A2D' equ. 69(b) is used. If set to 'E2S' or any other string equ 69(a) is used.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating whether horizontal or line-of-sight wind should be used. This flag can be set to either "true" or "false". A "true" value indicates that the line of sight wind velocity is computed, and a "false" value indicates that horizontal wind velocity is computed
Minimum number of Mie ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of Rayleigh ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be above center of DEM intersection bin
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be below center of DEM intersection bin

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating wether the Rayleigh response correction shall be performed using the array of response errors of the AUX_RRC file or the polynomial fit of the response errors. A 'TRUE' value indicates that the polynomial fit parameters are used.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mie ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Minimum derivative of Mie signal for ground detection
Maximum Mie Response shift for ground detection
Minimum derivative of Rayleigh signal shift forground detection
Maximum Rayleigh Response shift for ground detection
Maximum FWHM of Mie signal for ground detection
Offset between Mie and Rayleigh ground corrections
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie ground echo
Weighting parameter for Mie harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for Rayleigh harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie harmonic

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold for the number of bad pulses in each measurement

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold for the for the multimode average ratio over an observation
Retrieved wind values above this threshold are flagged invalid

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate if the fitted non-linearities should be used for the Mie processing instead of non-linearities of the input AUX_MRC_1B
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the internal path
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the atmospheric path

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Instrument Spectral Registration

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of valid Mie pulses needed to generate valid output data for a frequency step
Minimum number of valid Rayleigh pulses needed to generate valid output data for a frequency step

cd:Float.cd:Description: ACCD pixel position expected to be in the middle of the Mie USR

The Energy_Drift_Correction_Factor describes a difference of the laser energy measured by PD74 and the actual signal level detected by the RSP ACCD. Such a difference might be caused by slightly different illumination angles of the different optical paths.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of frequency steps

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Instrument Auto Test

cd:Float.cd:Description: Lorentz refinement resolution ratio for creating the delta value of the estimate. (delta estimate = estimate / ratio) Given estimated value x, and refinement resolution r. Three adjacent points Lorentz(x), Lorentz(x+x/r), Lorentz(x-x/r) are computed for least squares fit. The refinement resolution r must be greater than 1.0
Lorentz refinement threshold. If ratio between delta(estimate) / estimate smaller than the threshold, stop the iteration and report the value

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of valid Mie pulses needed to generate valid output data for a frequency step
Minimum number of valid Rayleigh pulses needed to generate valid output data for a frequency step

cd:Float.cd:Description: Lower frequency limit that defines the Mie fit range
Upper frequency limit that defines the Mie fit range

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Dark Current Calibration

cd:Float.cd:Description: Factor used to count the number of pixels that are more than this factor * DSNU away from the mean

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Instrument Defocus Characterisation

cd:Integer.cd:Description: IDC image summation range maximum row
IDC image summation range miminum row
IDC image summation range maximum column for channel 1
IDC image summation range minimun column for channel 1
IDC image summation range maximum column for channel 2
IDC image summation range minimun column for channel 2
The upper limit integration time used for the verification in IDC mode
The lower limit integration time used for the verification in IDC mode

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for standard deviation of energetic centroid column and row standard deviation

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Response Calibration

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum valid frequencies per calibration
Minimum valid frequencies per reference pulse calibration
Minimum valid measurements per frequency
Minimum valid pulses per frequency

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Rayleigh Response Calibration

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum mean sensitivity of atmosperic echo
Minimum zero frequency reponse of atmosperic echo
Maximum mean sensitivity of atmosperic echo
Maximum zero frequency reponse of atmosperic echo
Maximum error response standard deviation of atmosperic echo
Minimum mean sensitivity of internal calibration
Minimum zero frequency reponse of internal calibration
Maximum mean sensitivity of internal calibration
Maximum zero frequency reponse of internal calibration
Maximum error response standard deviation of internal calibration
Upper frequency range when computing the best fit
Lower frequency range when computing the best fit
Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be above center of DEM intersection bin
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be below center of DEM intersection bin
Maximum Mie Resonse shift for ground detection
Minimum derivative of Mie signal for ground detection
If MieCore2 is used and the retrieved FWHM of the ground return signal is above this threshold, the ground detection is flagged invalid.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Rayleigh Response Calibration

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum valid frequencies per calibration
Minimum valid ground frequencies per calibration
Minimum valid frequencies per reference pulse calibration
Minimum valid measurements per frequency
Minimum valid ground measurements per frequency
Minimum valid pulses per frequency

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Rayleigh Response Calibration

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum mean sensitivity of atmosperic echo
Minimum zero frequency reponse of atmosperic echo
Maximum mean sensitivity of atmosperic echo
Maximum zero frequency reponse of atmosperic echo
Maximum error response standard deviation of atmosperic echo
Minimum mean sensitivity of ground echo
Minimum zero frequency reponse of ground echo
Maximum mean sensitivity of ground echo
Maximum zero frequency reponse of ground echo
Maximum error response standard deviation of ground echo
Minimum mean sensitivity of internal calibration
Minimum zero frequency reponse of internal calibration
Maximum mean sensitivity of internal calibration
Maximum zero frequency reponse of internal calibration
Maximum error response standard deviation of internal calibration
Upper frequency range when computing the best fit
Lower frequency range when computing the best fit

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Degree of polynomial used for fitting of frequency step response errors, default setting: 5.

cd:Float.cd:Description: RRC lower altitude limit
RRC upper altitude limit
Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be above center of DEM intersection bin.
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be below center of DEM intersection bin.
Minimum derivative of Rayleigh signal shift for ground detection
Maximum Rayleigh Response shift for ground detection
RRC RSP Etalon range threshold

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Apply outlier detection algorithm on response TRUE/FALSE.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold value for maximum difference between calculated and ideal atmospheric response for a certain frequency step.
Threshold value for maximum difference between calculated and ideal ground response for a certain frequency step.
Threshold value for maximum difference between calculated and ideal reference pulse response for a certain frequency step.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Apply scattering ratio quality control to atmospheric data TRUE/FALSE.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold for maximum Mie scattering ratio used to discard data of Rayleigh atmospheric measurement bins.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Offline Wind Measurement

cd:Text.cd:Description: String indicating source of AISP data product. If set to 'A2D' equ. 69(b) is used. If set to 'E2S' or any other string equ 69(a) is used.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating whether horizontal or line-of-sight wind should be used. This flag can be set to either "true" or "false". A "true" value indicates that the line of sight wind velocity is computed, and a "false" value indicates that horizontal wind velocity is computed
Minimum number of Mie ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of Rayleigh ground wind measurement bins to validate ground correction factor

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates land surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level

Threshold applied to coadded gound signal of a measurement if the surface indicates water/sea ice surface. If the threshold is met, the signal is added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Threshold applied to a bin identified as ground bin candidate. If the threshold is not met, the signal of the bin is not added to the sum of the ground signal on observation level
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be above center of DEM intersection bin
Maximum height difference that center of detected ground bin is allowed to be below center of DEM intersection bin

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating wether the Rayleigh response correction shall be performed using the array of response errors of the AUX_RRC file or the polynomial fit of the response errors. A 'TRUE' value indicates that the polynomial fit parameters are used.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mie ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Minimum derivative of Mie signal for ground detection
Maximum Mie Response shift for ground detection
Minimum derivative of Rayleigh signal shift forground detection
Maximum Rayleigh Response shift for ground detection
Maximum FWHM of Mie signal for ground detection
Offset between Mie and Rayleigh ground corrections
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie ground echo
Weighting parameter for Mie harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for Rayleigh harmonic correction
Weighting parameter for correction of Rayleigh with Mie harmonic

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold for the number of bad pulses in each measurement

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold for the for the multimode average ratio over an observation
Retrieved wind values above this threshold are flagged invalid

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag TRUE/FALSE to indicate if the fitted non-linearities should be used for the Mie processing instead of non-linearities of the input AUX_MRC_1B
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the internal path
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the atmospheric path

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Zero Wind Calibration
Processing parameters for Dark Current Memory Zone Calibration

cd:Float.cd:Description: Rayleigh solar background threshold applied to the summiarized background of each Rayleigh measurement, to identify measurements affected by high solar background.
Threshold applied to the absolute zScore values to identify outliers.
In case the retrieved Rayleigh dark current rate for a certain pixel is below 0.0, it is replaced in the output by this default value.
In case the retrieved Mie dark current rate for a certain pixel is below 0.0, it is replaced in the output by this default value.
If the top of a certain height bin in meters + Altitude_Offset_Margin is above 0 meters, retrieved dark current rates are replaced by the dark current rates of the input DCMZ file.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If the number of Mie or Rayleigh observations used to retrieve dark current rates is less than the value stated here, the calibration is flagged invalid in the SPH.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Laser Beam Monitoring Calibration

cd:Float.cd:Description: Factor used to calculate the binarization threshold

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum iterations of least squares ellipse fit

cd:Float.cd:Description: Factor used to vary diagonal elements of transmission matrix
Maximum variation of diagonal elements of transmission matrix
Minimum variation of diagonal elements of transmission matrix
Tolerance to check convergence of least squares error

cd:Record.cd:Description: Common Processing Params
Processing parameters for Mie product confidence params SNR and backscatter-ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SNR

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Summation index for calculation of SNR and backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Coefficient for x^3 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^2 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^1 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^0 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm

cd:Float.cd:Description: Gaussian width a. This value should be approximately the fringe FWHM
Peak error threshold
Peak error threshold for internal reference path signal

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of gaussian iterations

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Stop threshold for quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentzfit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off for internal reference path signal
Starting value for FWHM for internal reference path signal

Stop threshold for change of quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel: if the difference between the quadratic sum from the previous to the next iteration loop is below this threshold, the iteration is stopped for internal reference path signal
Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop for internal reference path signal
Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check for internal reference path signal
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check for internal reference path signal
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function for internal reference path signal
Relative threshold for peak height of Lorentz function for internal reference path signal
Peak location threshold for internal reference path signal
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function for internal reference path signal
Maximum number of iterations of Downhill Simplex algorithm for internal reference path signal
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel for internal reference path signal

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag showing if the downhill simplex is on or off. If it is off (FALSE) a method using least squares minimization is used instead of DownHill Simplex

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Rayleigh algorithm

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Define start pixel for useful signal calculation of channel A
Define stop pixel for useful signal calculation of channel A
Define start pixel for useful signal calculation of channel B
Define stop pixel for useful signal calculation of channel B

cd:Float.cd:Description: Signal To Noise Threshold

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for corrupt data detection

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Max signal derivative. Maximum valid pixel intensity difference between adjacent CCD pixels
Pixel saturation threshold

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for corrupt data detection

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag that switches the DCO correction algorithm. If set to 'false', every ACCD row will be corrected using for the Mie the mean of pixel 19 and 20 and for Rayleigh only pixel 20 of that row. If set to true, a measurement mean DCO value will be calculated.

After calculation of mean DCO and std dev, DCO values that differ more than the specified factor times the std dev will be discarded for calculation of mean DCO. Not used if DCO_Pre_Processing is set to 'false'.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Specifies the offset between the calculated mean DCO of a measurement and the DCO correction value that shall be applied to the background row of a measurement. Not used if DCO_Pre_Processing is set to 'false'.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Correct Nadir mode measured data for satellite velocity using ideal RRC/MRC response slopes.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Time that laser needs to stabilize after a frequency change.
